cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi W of Cabo Cruz, Cuba and 100 mi S of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across central-western Cuba late Sun-Mon, then turning north-northwest across the Florida Straits and up the west coast of Florida Tue–Wed before accelerating northeast across GA/SC/NC and passing just east of the Mid-Atlantic coast late Thu-Fri.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (likely Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cayman Brac and Little Cayman, upper Florida Keys east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, and the west coast of Florida from Flamingo northward to the Anclote River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas; numerous Cuban provinces
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and western Cuba, Florida Keys and west coast of Florida, Florida Big Bend, coastal Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina and the Mid-Atlantic coast (including Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts 25–35 mph with occasional higher gusts possible Fri.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; passage well inland/offshore should limit surge at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible late Thu–Fri as Elsa’s remnants pass nearby, causing periods of heavy showers and brief ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in outer rain-bands and possible short-term visibility restrictions for marine traffic.
